comment: Honestly the easiest art history class, everything is explained thoroughly in her lectures. You only have to do a few discussion posts and a paper. Tests are open-note but she has a study guide to prepare by the end of each module.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. S is an incredible professor. She loves what she teaches and her lectures are enjoyable. She cares about her students. I recommend speaking to her directly after class or during the 10 min. break if you have any questions. The work-load is manageable. She's the best at KSU in the Art History dept. I took all of her classes. Highly recommend!

Dr. Stephenson is the best Art History professor at KSU. If you attend class and put in effort, you will do great! She is sweet and cares about her students. There are usually three tests, with the last one being an open-note, in class essay. She loves what she teaches and if you get lucky, a class field trip will be taken.

This is the second time I've taken one of Dr. Stephenson's classes and she is a wonderful professor and person. The lectures are long but the tests are easy if you take good notes and pay attention. She is passionate about what she teaches and appreciates participation. Assignments aren't too difficult either.

She is probably one of the easiest* teachers you can take in Art History at KSU (*comparatively--art history is hard). I think it was mostly due to it being an online course. There is lots of memorization but thankfully she gives study guides for the assessments so it's a lot easier to study for. Other professors' exams are way harder than hers.

I heard so many good things about her, and her class ended up being awful. Her lectures were okay, but then she would never respond to anyone's emails, even for calling out sick. She was impossible to contact and didn't grade our first test until after we'd taken the second one. Mentioned assignments and then never gave them out.

Workload is kinda heavy, doesnt respond and rarely grades. Tough grader on the discussions but she will let you redo them for better grade. 3 tests each 20%, 1 paper 10%, 6 discussions each 5%. Tests are 1 hour & cover alot. The class average for our 1st test was a C, that should tell you all you need to know. You can make an A but will work for it
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Strict attendance policy, but she cancelled 3 or 4 times (and it was only a once a week class), kept mentioning assignments we were going to have, then never assigning them. Took months to get grades back, only had two grades in at the beginning of december. Tests were like 5 or 6 short essay questions. Overall just unorganized and confusing.

Straight forward criteria w/ weekly reading, lecture, & modules (although only required to do 6). Can find the pdf of the textbook on B-okorg. Prefers to be contacted through D2L instead of email. There's 1 essay: a formal analysis w/ a piece from the Carlos Museum (can be done online). Responds in a timely manner. Didn't update some lectures/info
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Definitely have to get the textbook, but all of the tests were open note and open book. Doesn't try to trick you or assign too much. Very doable class and really nice teacher.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Stephenson has an amazing depth of knowledge in her fields, and the personality to share that knowledge in an engaging manner. She clearly cares deeply about her students, and is excellent when it comes to giving detailed answers to specific questions. Her course was challenging, but fair. If you prepare for the exams , you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I took this class online so I can't say much about her personality, but she is very organized and responsive. Uploaded a module every week with lecture, textbook reading, and review guide. Tests were a bit hard but open note. Course is straight forward: 6 discussion posts, 3 tests, and analysis paper at end. Definitely would take her again.

She uploads the modules weekly and every 5th module is the test. You get a week to study for the tests which really isn't needed as long as you read/listened to the lectures and have the book near when you start the test. The discussions are fun to write and think about and you only have to do 6 of them. Put in some effort and you'll pass.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Get ready to read

comment: You can tell that she is very knowledgable about what she teaches. Her assignments were straight forward and easy as long as you read the assigned readings.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is the sweetest professor. She gives 3-4 tests, 3ish essays, and some homework and sometimes lets students do interactive on campus activities with different forms of art. Has an interesting accent and loves what she does. She is clear about her tests and expectations. No reason to do bad in her class, and she cares deeply for the students.
She is one of the most amazing professor I have had so far. She is funny and never boring. She is an easy grader. If you get to have her, you are one of the luckiest people at KSU.

Maymester with her was very fun! At first it seems like a lot of work, but after getting into it, it's not that much to do. You can complete all four discussion posts at once or separately. They just have to be completed before their due dates. Museum assignment was very fun! And exams were semi easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is a great professor. She gave clear instructions for everything online. It was super easy. You only had to do three tests, four discussion posts, and one museum assignment. I would 100% take her again.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Stephenson is a great professor. She keeps the class interesting, and her accent is very cool. She's funny and grades pretty easily. Great class and teacher.
Very easy class that consisted of a few tests, a few discussion posts, and a paper. Would take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took her for the online maymester. Easiest A ever! The reading plan she gives look crazy at first (i.e. sometimes up to 60 pages of reading a night), but you do not need to read! Her online tests do not use lockdown browser, and 90% of her questions are word for word on quizlet. The other 10% are in the book, so you still need it though! 10/10
The class can get boring if you don't enjoy art, but the professor it very knowledgeable and interesting in her own right. Just stage a happening and you don't need to have class.

One of the best professors I've ever had. She knew so much about what she was teaching and really cared about the content. Really good with time management. The only drawback was the trip to the museum at Emory but I enjoyed myself there. I never got a grade lower than an 90.

She's a really neat teacher. Not super personable, but still friendly. She will send you to a museum at Emory, which is a hike (about an hour plus some drive) and traffic is horrible, so that you can write a paper. May or may not be worth it, but I still thought it was cool.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: When you have to sit in class for an hour plus, her South African accent with phenomenal vocabulary is definitely pleasant to listen to. The class itself was not hard. I feel she grades generously and is not too harsh on attendance. Read the book, do the study guides, and you'll pass with flying colors.

I took Dr. Stephenson's ART 1107 during Maymester and it was a great experience. She was organized and that helped with planning the workload. Her participation questions were thought-provoking. The text covered art analysis and history. You have to read the assigned chapters to do well on the quizzes. I'd recommend this class for your univ rqrm't.

3 Tests, makes you memorize about 50-70 works of art (title, author, date, context, iconography, style, significance), but then tests you on only about ten. She has an accent so its difficult to understand her sometimes. Pretty straight forward class. 1 paper (4-5 pages). A lot of information, but interesting.
An entirely lecture class, but she is a really sweet person. Her South African accent is pretty cool, too.
Please take her!!! I was bored even by the thought of art but she made it so interesting! Great professor and really one of the best!!! Took it as a maymester.

Dr. Stephenson is fantastic! I was not at all interested in taking this class, but she made it really enjoyable. Take it as a Maymester if you can. It was really easy and very interesting! One of the best teachers I've had at KSU!

An absolutely amazing professor! Took Dr. Stephenson for a Maymester art class and LOVED her! Her tests are lengthy with several paragraph answer questions and two short essays (400 words), then a section for multiple choice, true false and best answer but if you are in class taking notes and do the reading you should be fine! INCREDIBLE PROFESSOR!

Class is kind of hard.  You definitely need to study for the test if you want an A.  She is kind of confusing with some of the stuff she says.  Also make sure to ask plenty of question is you take her because she won't go over stuff again.

Dr. Stephenson is awesome! She is a fun lecturer and her class is very interesting. She gives you a lot of opportunities to raise your grade. She gives helpful study guides and is clear about what will be on the test. Take her if you can!

Prof Stephenson is great. She is very intelligent and she's charming. She lectures the whole time, which I don't mind. Her tests and assignments are straightforward and pretty easy if you try. She is a slow grader, though.

VERY easy class, but not the most interesting. If you study, the tests are super easy. She's a little harsh on grading test reviews but offers an easy extra credit assignment that can add up to five points to your grade. Definitely take this professor if you have to take art.
Boring class but the tests are easy. Can get all the information you need from book and vista. She lectures the whole time but she's nice. Good class.

Okay, so we are 'required' to take a Humanities Art class. Then this is the one to take! This is a 'History' of Art in the World. And if you are any type of a History buff at all, you will LOVE this class. You get points for attendance & are allowed 2 'excused' then she deducts points if you miss. EASY tests, READ the book, Lectures interesting!

I found her lectures easy to pay attention to. She's understanding when it comes to the end of the semester and made the last test have fewer works than the others. If you pay attention to her lectures, you'll do fine. I only used the book for memorizing works, but I still got an A. She doesn't give you any real heads up for essay questions though.

She isn't hard. Attend class, read the book, do the in-class and outside-class assignments, and you'll be fine. However, be warned that she is rather disorganized (check Vista often) and her lectures are dry. She takes a long time to respond to emails and post grades.

she's an easy teacher, but the class is sooo boring. it takes her WEEKS to give you the grade to a SCANTRON test. The group assignments that we did in September we didn't get our grades back until November....very annoying. attendance isn't required for lecture days.

I didn't really attend class except for the days necessary for group assignments and tests, but as long as you study the art figures and do your study guides, you're guaranteed to get an A. This is a really easy class.

I really enjoyed this class! I wish it had a second half. Her material is well-presented and interesting. She is very friendly and approachable and will bend over backward for her students. She won't put up with any BS, but I'd expect that from *any* professor. I absolutely would take a class with her again.

She is seriously one of the best teachers I've ever had. She brings so much to Art History at KSU. Besides Sachs, she has got to be my favorite. African Art History is hard but it is a quality class and even though I think I earned a B, she knew I tried hard and gave me an A anyway. She is amazing!

The easiest class i've taken at KSU. Attendance is only mandatory like 5 days for a group assignment and 3 test. The test are the easiest things ever made. She gives you a study guide and some additional questions. ALL of those questions are on the test. Impossible to not get an A. Although, she may seem a little snobby, i would take her again.

she takes FOREVER to grade things and respond to emails. other than that the class was very easy. the first test was extremely hard (seemed like trick questions), so i ended up with a B, but i also missed a lot of class. she doesn't take attendance.

Do not take a class with this professor. The syllabus is a mess, and she doesn't answer question or e-mails. She also cancels class without any notice and is always running late. She takes forever to grade papers, so you don't have any idea what your grade is until the end of the semester. If you loved art before this class, you'll hate it after.

DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK! It is used to help with tests, but she covers plenty of info in her powerpoints to help you prepare for them. I took the summer session, so there were three tests, two papers, in-class assignments, one extra credit assignment, you have to attend one music and one theater event, etc. Her syllabus is kind of unclear..

Easy! Study all notes from class and you'll get an A. Only used book to look at pictures for test.  Gives tons of extra credit.  Attendance is mandatory, which can be a pain.  She's smart and nice. Only about 3-4 short papers, very easy.  I studied a few hours before the tests and got an A in her class.  I highly recommend her.

Really an interesting class. Professor Stephenson is so very nice and she really loves her art. Two papers which were fairly easy. I got a 60 on the first test an b's on the others and still walked with an A in the class. She offers a good bit of extra credit. Takes attendance every class.

Tests are tricky, attendance is mandatory counts as 15% of your grade.  3 papers, she is very slow to grade them.  The class was interesting.  She works with you but you can tell she is a professor second.  I did learn in this class though.

tests are strange and threw me off.I am not majoring in art,and have a logic mind set,which I don't think she understands,she thinks we all should see that invisible line, and suggested thought of the piece! First test I got a 70 on(class avg. was 65), the second I got a 100, so she definitely clarified what she wanted out of us by the second half.

Professor Stephenson is A Curator of ART at Emory University.  She is very very knowledgeable and passionate about her curriculum.  If you are trying to get an easy grade this class is not for you. However, if you are willing to put forth some effort, come to class and pay attention you will do well in this class.

Sure the attendance policy is crazy but why not show up if you are paying for the class? Lots of assignments but they are short and easy. Liked the discussions about museums and the art market. The class size is way big, make them smaller.

Boring, gets mad when students try to leave early. REALLY CONFUSING SYLLABUS! the class has too many papers for my liking, off campus museums, theatre reports, music even reports, on campus art museum, and the final was a paper. tests are kinda hard, not too bad. Big presentatoin with groups. If you take her it wont bee too bad. ITS NOT ART HISTORY

She is very boring and most of the time you just listen to her lecture. If you do the work (which isn't hard) you'll pass. I got an A. The tests can be a bit confusing, but though attendance is mandatory you can always sign in and then leave without her really noticing.

Attendance is mandatory, but if you are paying for classes why not show up?  The tests are sort of hard but she lists everything you need to know at the beginning of each lecture.  She offers extra credit every so often and extra activities help boost your grades.  She is not bad, just be ready to apply yourself.

Attendance is required and she counts down for tardiness...although she is late on a regular basis.  Not very organized..takes a long time to reply to e-mails (if at all) and takes FOREVER to get a test grade back...tests are very poorly written and are very difficult to study for.

She def. knows a lot about art.. be prepared to take a lot of notes! 3 tests.. all of which were pretty hard. You HAVE to study. It was interesting, however, and I learned a lot. She came in late for 2 of our tests (frustrating because I had another exam directly after the class), but overall I definitely recommend her! She's so nice!
Great teacher, just make sure you take good notes. Had to write 5 papers total and go to 4 events; music, theater, ect....
Wasn't that interested in Art, but I did learn. Attend class, 20% of grade. Group projects and Art events were fun. Prof Stephenson is easy going and not a hard grader. Do the work easy A or B.
Very nice person.  You have to jump through a lot of hoops, but she is very knowledgeable in her field.
No Comments

Nice enough lady, but doesn't seem very organized. Almost always comes in late, and never seems to have time to grade everyone's tests. On the other hand, she always asks for feedback on her tests, and they're rather easy. She also tends to add bonus points to everyone's tests (because she says she's not so great at math...).
